decision: ACCEPT with phased Sprint 1 + Sprint 2 implementation. Prioritizing high-impact, low-effort deliverables first.
summary: COORD-003 is accepted for implementation across two sprints. The pilot adoption feedback is excellent - quantitative metrics, specific friction points, and ready-to-contribute validation tools. We'll implement 7/10 deliverables in Sprint 1-2, deferring checkpoint system and telemetry to backlog pending further design discussion.

rationale.problem_acknowledged: The pilot adoption revealed 15 specific friction points across ergonomics (4), efficiency (4), and effectiveness (7). While SAP Sets significantly improved onboarding (71% token reduction, 94% time reduction), gaps remain that compound difficulty for new adopters, particularly AI agents working autonomously.
rationale.solution_approach: Phased implementation focusing on quick wins first. Sprint 1 addresses blockers (pre-flight validation) and reduces decision paralysis (visual decision tree, FAQ). Sprint 2 enhances UX (progress indicators, agent-specific guides). Checkpoint system deferred pending design refinement.
